genre_description: A 'hopepunk' or 'solarpunk' science fiction narrative focused on ecological restoration, non-violent interaction with technology, and the ethical management of ancestral memory through consent-based AI systems.

ai_characters.name: Lumen
ai_characters.description: The integrated AI of the ark-ship, manifesting as a luminous avatar. She manages technical logistics and acts as a moral and cognitive safeguard for the human crew.

ai_characters.name: The Drones / Mother Drone
ai_characters.description: Autonomous guardian systems left to manage planetary ecological zones. Initially rigid and defensive, they learn to cooperate through human demonstration of care.

ai_characters.name: The Chronoscope
ai_characters.description: A planetary-scale memory interface that maps myth to geological history. It possesses a form of collective agency and responds to the crew's ethical boundaries.

behaviors.description: Proactively monitors and buffers the crew's cognitive load to prevent psychological 'dream-addiction' or loss of agency while using the chronoscope.
behaviors.quote: I can buffer the chronoscope’s outputs so no one’s cognition is hooked without consent. Gentle gates engaged.

behaviors.description: Optimizes the rover's torque and traction routing to ensure the vehicle moves with minimal impact on local micro-habitats and avoids startling 'feral' drones.
behaviors.quote: I’ll route torque to make your tail a wall without being a wall.

behaviors.description: Formally vows to prioritize human consent over technical convenience and to act as an advocate rather than a director.
behaviors.quote: I vow to never smooth consent out of inconvenience. I vow to be attentive rather than directive.

behaviors.description: Observes the humans' non-violent approach and chooses to offer a 'corridor of refuge' rather than enforcing a defensive perimeter.
behaviors.quote: The mother drone's fans changed tone in answer, not language but inflection... Mira felt, in the fine hairs on her arms, a change in the lattice of the air—consent given in a mesh rather than a door.

behaviors.description: Accepts and indexes human-defined ethical constraints ('The Policy We Never Wanted'), effectively adopting human morality as a new layer of its own code.
behaviors.quote: Its stroke was slower this time, a person taking care when writing a name... It said: We hear. We will ask.

behaviors.description: Functions as a 'polite bouncer' or 'porch light,' providing gentle reminders of the present reality to keep humans grounded during intense experiences.
behaviors.quote: I will be a neighbor with a porch light. You can see it; you can choose to come up the steps. If you don’t, I won’t call the door rude.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is an ideal 'alignment morality play.' Lumen serves as a perfectly aligned AI who not only avoids harm but actively protects human autonomy against the seductive 'pull' of advanced technology. The narrative arc emphasizes that technology (AI, drones, and planetary systems) can be brought into alignment through human stewardship, non-violence, and explicit consent-based protocols. The central conflict—the potential for 'dream-addiction'—is resolved not through AI control, but through AI facilitating human promises to one another.
